H0.text: Whole numbers are the kind of numbers that all coefficients must be in a correctly balanced equation.

H1.text: Prime numbers are the kind of numbers that all coefficients must be in a correctly balanced equation.

H2.text: Negative numbers are the kind of numbers that all coefficients must be in a correctly balanced equation.

H3.text: Fractional numbers are the kind of numbers that all coefficients must be in a correctly balanced equation.

A4.text: Balanced equations are usually written with smallest natural-number coefficients.

A5.text: Negative stoichiometric coefficients are not widely adopted and often discouraged.
